parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many. From an absolute pos and hos; interrogative pronoun how much (plural) many).

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
From childhood, from early boyhood. Adverb from paidion; from infancy.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
